words.meaning: having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations
words.example: He made astute observations during the meeting.
words.japaneseExample: 彼は会議中に鋭敏な観察をした。

words.meaning: relating to or characterized by reversion to something ancient or ancestral
words.example: His atavistic fears seemed irrational in modern society.
words.japaneseExample: 彼の原始的な恐怖は現代社会では非合理的に思えた。

words.example: The conditions in the camp were atrocious.
words.japaneseExample: キャンプの状況はひどかった。

words.meaning: able to be achieved or accomplished
words.japaneseExample: 現実的で達成可能な目標を設定する。

words.meaning: to reduce the force, effect, or value of something
words.example: The medication helped attenuate the symptoms.
words.japaneseExample: 薬が症状を弱めるのに役立った。

words.meaning: showing a willingness to take bold risks
words.example: The entrepreneur made an audacious investment.
words.japaneseExample: その起業家は大胆な投資を行った。

words.meaning: to make something greater by adding to it
words.example: He worked to augment his income.
words.japaneseExample: 彼は収入を増やすために働いた。

words.meaning: a sign of what will happen in the future; an omen
words.example: The dark clouds were an augury of the storm.
words.japaneseExample: 暗い雲は嵐の前兆だった。

words.example: It was an auspicious start to the new project.
words.japaneseExample: 新しいプロジェクトの開始は幸先が良かった。

words.meaning: severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance
words.example: The monk lived an austere life.
words.japaneseExample: その修道士は質素な生活を送った。
